title: Ticket #608: If VMware is installed, make it's services dependencies of Condor
description: It seems that sometimes the Condor service starts before the VMware service have, and if VM Universe support is enabled, this will cause the vm-gaph to fail. Thus, if we detect, at install time, that VMware is installed, we should then make Condor explicitly dependent on the VMware services.
remarks:
2009-Jun-30 06:42:30 by matt:
This is not only a problem on Windows, and it is the same problem we had with the credd. A better solution is to allow the startd to re-check for VMU support, see #551

2009-Jun-30 15:26:01 by burnett:
Fair enough, I didn't realize it was failing in this manner on other OS (although I can easily imagine the init.d/rc.d configuration that would lead it too).

2009-Oct-21 15:34:40 by psilord:
Ben Burnett has left the Condor Project. This ticket is being unassigned.
